docs.snippet: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Jews held a mass prayer in Jerusalem on Sunday in protest at a bill that would cut their community's military exemptions and end a tradition upheld since Israel's foundation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Jews held a mass prayer in Jerusalem on Sunday in protest at a bill that would cut their community's military exemptions and end a tradition upheld since Israel's foundation.

headline.main: Ultra-Orthodox Jews Stage Mass Protest Against Israeli Draft Law
headline.print_headline: Ultra-Orthodox Jews Stage Mass Protest Against Israeli Draft Law

docs.snippet: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating Citigroup for accounting fraud after it disclosed bogus loans in its Mexican Banamex unit, a source familiar with the investigation said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating Citigroup for accounting fraud after it disclosed bogus loans in its Mexican Banamex unit, a source familiar with the investigation said.

headline.main: SEC Investigates Citigroup Over Fraudulent Mexican Loans: Source
headline.print_headline: SEC Investigates Citigroup Over Fraudulent Mexican Loans: Source

docs.snippet: Thousands of Venezuelans have escaped to the beach for the long Carnival weekend, heeding President Nicolas Maduro's call to leave behind nearly a month of anti-government protests....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of Venezuelans have escaped to the beach for the long Carnival weekend, heeding President Nicolas Maduro's call to leave behind nearly a month of anti-government protests.

headline.main: Tired of Protests, Venezuelans Take Politics to the Beach
headline.print_headline: Tired of Protests, Venezuelans Take Politics to the Beach

docs.snippet: Egypt's new prime minister on Sunday urged a halt to protests and strikes to give the nation a breather to rebuild after more than three years of deadly turmoil, a call made by his predecessors to no avail....
docs.lead_paragraph: Egypt's new prime minister on Sunday urged a halt to protests and strikes to give the nation a breather to rebuild after more than three years of deadly turmoil, a call made by his predecessors to no avail.

headline.main: Egypt's New Premier Calls for Protests to End
headline.print_headline: Egypt's New Premier Calls for Protests to End

docs.snippet: A Philadelphia man’s 1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V, an ungainly beast that is hard to miss, is from an era when cars were huge....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Philadelphia man’s 1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V, an ungainly beast that is hard to miss, is from an era when cars were huge.
docs.abstract: Philadelphia resident Chris Rossi owns turquoise 1960 Lincoln Continental Mark V, ungainly car that redefined boundaries of excess at a time when large cars were the norm.

headline.main: Ugly? It’s a Crowd Pleaser Now
headline.print_headline: Ugly? It’s a Crowd Pleaser Now

docs.snippet: Witnesses to chilling violence at a Chinese train station placed under heavy security on Sunday recalled moments of fear and chaos after at least 29 people were killed in what authorities called a terrorist attack by Xinjiang militants....
docs.lead_paragraph: Witnesses to chilling violence at a Chinese train station placed under heavy security on Sunday recalled moments of fear and chaos after at least 29 people were killed in what authorities called a terrorist attack by Xinjiang militants.

headline.main: Witnesses Recall Fear, Chaos After China Train Station Attack
headline.print_headline: Witnesses Recall Fear, Chaos After China Train Station Attack
